intro: Iresine ajuscana f. longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered iron plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking, often colorful foliage. The plant features slender, erect stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that can range in color from red to purple. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and may have a velvety texture. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of growing conditions.
